questions.text: Match Column A with B
Following statements about trigeminal nerve is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Mandibular branch supplies the angle of the jaw

options.label: B
options.text: Has 3 major branches all of which leave through the common foramen in skull

options.label: C
options.text: Ophthalmic division carries information from the tip of nose

options.label: D
options.text: Maxillary division is the largest branch of trigeminal nerve

questions.correct_answer: C. Ophthalmic division carries information from the tip of nose

questions.text: A 25 years old man is involved in an automobile accident and slams his head into a concrete wall of a bridge. His CT scan reveals that the middle meningeal artery has ruptured but the meninges remain intact. Blood leaking from this artery enters which of the following spaces?
A patient's left hypoglossal nerve (CN XII) is injured during a surgical procedure. Which of the fol¬lowing would most likely result from this injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased gag reﬂex on the left

options.label: B
options.text: Inability to elevate the pharynx on the left during swallowing

options.label: C
options.text: Deviation of the tongue to the left on protrusion

options.label: D
options.text: Deviation of the tongue to the right on protrusion

questions.correct_answer: C. Deviation of the tongue to the left on protrusion

questions.text: Read the Following statements regarding blood supplyA aneurysm involving which of the artery is most likely responsible for this patients symptoms ? A. Primary Motor area – MCA, ACA B. Primary Sensory area – MCA, ACA C. Macula – MCA, PCA D. Speech area– MCA
Which of the Following passes through Guyon’s canal?
Choose the correct sequence of the following Structures in cubital fossa from lateral to medial 1. Tendon of biceps 2. Brachial artery 3. Median Nerve 4. Radial Nerve
Identify the muscle shown in ﬁgure
Structures passing through marked foramen are all except:
Main action of marked muscle on the TM joint in the below image is ?

Some mucopolysaccharidoses cause only connective tissue problems. In others, however, the patients have mental deficiency. Mental deficiency is most likely to occur in diseases with impaired breakdown of heparan sulfate, which is accumulated in 1. Hurler syndrome 2. San Filippo syndrome 3. Morquio syndrome 4. Maroteux lamy syndrome

In response to a large mixed meal, the number of glucose transporters in the plasma membrane increases most markedly in which one of the following cell types? 1. Adipocyte 2. Hepatocyte 3. Intestinal epithelial cell 4. Muscles
In patients who are at risk of developing Wernicke encephalopathy, a preventive infusion of thiamine, before administering glucose, ensures adequate activity of which of the following enzymes?
questions.correct_answer: C. α-Ketoglutarate dehydrogenase and pyruvate dehydrogenase

questions.text: 10-month-old child present with globally delayed developmental milestones. Abdominal examination is unremarkable but ophthalmic examination shows cherry red spot. Pathological specimens are remarkable for onion skinning of lysosomes. Which of the following enzyme deficiency is likely in lysosomes

A 16-year-old teenager boy presents with moderate to severe epigastric pain. Physical examination reveals extensive eruptive xanthomas and hepatosplenomegaly. A blood sample reveals milky plasma. Which of the following is the most likely lipoprotein to be elevated in the plasma of this patient accounting for the milky appearance?
Which of the following are derivatives of amino acids 1. Histamine and Dopamine 2. Haem and carnitine 3. Melanin and melatonin 4. NAD and glutathione

A 5-year-old child present with red scaly painful rash on sun exposed areas, frequent mood swings and unsteady gait. Urinalysis show gross neutral aminoaciduria, with exception of proline and glycine. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 22-year-old woman is diagnosed with gouty arthritis. Her 24-hour uric acid excretion is found to be 1.3 gram. Reduced activity of which enzyme could plausibly cause her hyperuricemia?

An infant is diagnosed with lactic acidosis due to impaired function of pyruvate dehydrogenase complex. In terms of diet which of the following is considered safe ,so that will not worsen the condition of patient.

Parenteral nutrition is instituted or a 4-day-old infant who has a total bilirubin of 18 mg/dL and a direct bilirubin of? 3.0 mg/dL. Which one of the following macronutrients in? the parenteral nutrition should be restricted in this patient?

A deep-sea diver is given a helium-oxygen mixture rather than nitrogen-oxygen mixture (with the same oxygen concentration) during his dive to a depth of 100m. Which of the following statements is true? (multiple true/ false) A. Risk of decompression sickness is decreased B. Work of breathing is increased C. Airway resistance is increased D. Risk of O2 toxicity is decreased E. Risk of inert gas narcosis is decreased

options.label: A
options.text: A- true; B- false; C- false; D- false; E- true

options.label: B
options.text: A- true; B- true; C- false; D- true; E- true

options.label: C
options.text: A- false; B- true; C- true; D- false; E- false

options.label: D
options.text: A- false; B- true; C- true; D- false; E- true

questions.correct_answer: A. A- true; B- false; C- false; D- false; E- true

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true regarding acclimatization at high altitude? (multiple true/ false) A. Hyperventilation is of little value B. Polycythemia occurs rapidly C. There is a rightward shift of the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve D. Number of capillaries per unit volume in skeletal muscle decreases E. Changes in oxidative enzymes occurs inside muscle cells

options.label: A
options.text: A- true; B- false; C- false; D- false; E- true

options.label: B
options.text: A- false; B- false; C- true; D- false; E- true

options.label: C
options.text: A- true; B- false; C- false; D- false; E- false

options.label: D
options.text: A- false; B- true; C- true; D- false; E- true

questions.correct_answer: B. A- false; B- false; C- true; D- false; E- true

questions.text: The patient appears dehydrated, and the plasma osmolality is 320 mOsm/kg. During a water deprivation test there was little increase in urine osmolarity after 6 hours. Desmopressin injection had little effect. Plasma and kidney tissue analysis would be expected to show which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased levels of ADH and increased V2 receptor activity

options.label: B
options.text: Increased levels of ADH and normal V2 receptor activity

options.label: C
options.text: Increased levels of ADH and decreased V2 receptor activity

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased levels of ADH and increased V2 receptor activity

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased levels of ADH and decreased V2 receptor activity

questions.text: A 31-year-old man arrived by ambulance at the emergency department after an industrial accident that cut the femoral artery, causing the loss of 1.5 L of blood. Bleeding was controlled by direct pressure, and the patient received 2 L of 0.9% saline during transport. The patient is pale, diaphoretic, and anxious. Vital signs: BP 80/60 mm Hg, P 120/min and weak, R 22/min and shallow, T 35.5°C. Which of the following changes in this patient is contributing to the narrowed arterial pulse pressure?

Given below are four statements regarding airway resistance of which one or more may be correct. Choose the correct option using the following key. a. Airway resistance is low in large as well as in small diameter airways b. Airway resistance is highest in medium sized airways c. Medium sized airways have a turbulent airflow which increases the resistance to airflow d. Density of the gas can also affect airway resistance

options.label: C
options.text: a, b, and c are correct

questions.text: The red lines in the figure given below illustrate the normal relationship between plasma insulin concentration and glucose production in the liver and between plasma insulin concentration and glucose uptake in muscle. Which line most likely illustrate these relationships in a patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus?

Read the following statements regarding coronary blood flow a. Normal resting coronary blood flow is 500mL/min. b. Majority of coronary flow occurs in systole. c. Local release of adenosine or infusion of adenosine increases coronary blood flow. d. During systole, the percentage decrease in subendocardial blood flow is greater than the percentage decrease in epicardial blood flow. e. Bradykinin, prostaglandins, CO2, potassium ions are potent coronary vasodilators. Choose the correct option using the following key.

options.label: B
options.text: Options a and b are correct

options.label: C
options.text: Options a, b, c are correct

options.label: D
options.text: Options c, d, e are correct

questions.correct_answer: D. Options c, d, e are correct

questions.text: An experiment is conducted in which ADH is administered at hour 3 to four subjects (A, B, C and D). in the figure given below, which lines most likely reflect the response to ADH administration in a normal subject and in a patient with central diabetes insipidus?

The following events occurred during the course of fever in a 12-year-old boy: (1) cutaneous vasodilation and sweating; (2) return of the set-point temperature to normal; (3) increase in the set-point temperature; (4) shivering, chills, cutaneous vasoconstriction. Which of the following is the correct sequence of events during the course of fever in this boy?
Given below is a graph of the electrodermal activity and skin conductance (also k/a Galvanic skin response) on the finger. Which of the following changes will NOT be seen following a fright?
True about cell injury is I. Increased intracellular Na II. Decreased intracellular H+ III. Increased intracellular Ca+2 IV. Decreased intracellular ATP V. Decreased intracellular pH

options.label: A
options.text: I, II, III, IV are correct

questions.text: Which of the following is true about wound healing? I. Type 1: type 3 collagen ratio is 1:4 up to 3 weeks II. Basal epithelial layer gets regenerated by 48 hours in a primary healing III. Ratio of type 1 to type 3 collagen is 4:1 at 3 months IV. Neutrophils are the first cell to arrive at the site of wound healing V. Primary healing have more strength than secondary healing

A 35 year healthy man had a snake bite, based on his description the doctor was confused between two most venomous snakes, following which he was administered polyvalent anti Snake Venom (ASV)and was discharged from the hospital after a week. Three days after discharge he develops high grade fever, arthralgia, lymphadenopathy, facial swelling and erythema in hands and feet. Which of the following explains the manifestations?

True statements about graft rejection are I. Chronic graft rejection is most common type of rejection II. Polyoma virus causes owl eye inclusions in the tubular cells III. Immuno supressives won’t be able to control hyper acute rejection IV. Tubulitis is microscopic finding in acute humoral rejection V. ABO matching is more important than HLA for kidney transplant
Match the following conditions with their causative proteins

A Sindhi couple is seeking genetic counselling for an inherited anemia, although both of them do not have any anemia, but the blood investigations show microcytic hypochromic picture. HPLC finding of husband is HbA 92%, HbA2 7%, HbF1% and wife HbA-94.5%, HbA2 4.5% HbF 1%. What is the likely hood of them having a child born with inherited anemia?
Which of the following disease doesn’t fit in the following pattern of inheritance

True about Warburg effect I. Shifts glucose metabolism from Aerobic to anerobic glucolysis II. Leads to reduced production of ATP in tumor cells III. Variant of pyruvate kinase induces it IV. Required for synthesis of nucleotides V. Can also happen in non-neoplastic hyperplastic cells

options.label: A
options.text: I, II, IV, V are true

options.label: B
options.text: II, III, IV, V are true

questions.correct_answer: B. II, III, IV, V are true

questions.text: Aschoff body contains I. T lymphocytes II. Neutrophils III. Plasma cells IV. Marcophages V. Giant cells

A 6 year child has a sore throat runny nose low grade fever and malaise. He was prescribed with antihistaminic and NSAIDs and sent home. He continues to take the drugs for a week time and feeling better. On day eight he has swelling in his both wrists and is unable to move. Clinically the wrists are tender for which the physician increased the NSAID dose and sent home again. Three days later presents with vomiting of blood and pain in the abdomen. CBC shows Hb 13g/dL, TLC 10000/cu.mm, platelet count 190000/cu.mm. Physical examination is as shown in the image. What is the likely diagnosis?
Histological examination of lung from a 1-day old neonate who died is as shown in the image. What is the likely pathogenesis in this neonate causing such disease?
Biopsy from lung mass in a patient is as follows which of the following is most likely clinical presentation of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A middle-aged woman who has never smoked

options.label: B
options.text: A male chronic smoker with hypercalcemia

options.label: C
options.text: A male smoker with lung mass and hemiparesis

options.label: D
options.text: A smoker male with renal mass and multiple lesions in lungs

questions.correct_answer: C. A male smoker with lung mass and hemiparesis

questions.text: Biopsy from a gastric tumor is as follows. Which of the following is not true about this case?

options.label: A
options.text: There will be loss of e Cadherin

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of mucosal rugae can be seen on gross examination.

questions.correct_answer: C. Due to APC  catenin mutation

options.label: A

questions.correct_answer: D. Bacillus atropheus sub spp globigi

questions.text: Match the Toxin and MOA

In one B cell, gene rearrangements create the variable region of the heavy chain and the light chain. Which of the following immunoglobulin gene rearrangements are not possible due to allelic exclusion?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the casuality with the complaints of fever, stiff neck, and headache. Vital signs reveal a temperature of 38.8°C. CSF Gram stain reveals the pathogen as shown in the image. Which of the following components is most critical for tagging this microorganism to enhance its engulfment by phagocytes?

A medical student is undergoing a Mantoux test. Few cellular events are given below. 1. Vascular permeability. 2. Hyperemia of superficial capillaries. 3. Cellular infiltration. 4. Histamine release Choose the best answer which defines the characteristic feature(s) that is measured as part of this test?

Choose the features suggestive of a child suffering from an immunodeficiency disorder as shown in the image due to deletion of 22q11. 1. Absence of CD20+ cells 2. Absence of CD3+ cells 3. Cleft palate 4. Patent Ductus Arteriosus

Choose the right characteristic(s) of rheumatoid factor, which may be found in the synovial fluid of patients with rheumatoid arthritis. 1. IgM reacting with the L chain of IgG 2. IgM reacting with the H chain of IgG 3. IgG reacting with the L chain of IgM 4. IgG reacting with the H chain of IgM
A 60-year-old diabetic women admitted for osteomyelitis. Pus culture and sensitivity revealed VRSA. What is the mechanism of action of VanA gene?

options.label: B
options.text: Augmented transport of drug out of the cell

options.label: D
options.text: Mutation of a penicillin binding protein (PBP)

questions.text: A Gram smear obtained from a case of urethritis shown in the image. Choose the correct statement(s) about the pathogen. 1. Symptoms are more severe in females than in males 2. Rectum and prostate are resistant to gonococci 3. Most patients present with symptoms of dysuria 4. Single dose of ciprofloxacin is effective in treatment 5. Commonly leads to arthritis 6. Water can perineum is the complication seen in men.

A man 50 years of age present with tinnitus, ear fullness and hearing loss in his right ear. Seven years later, he began to experience vertigo, headache, and progressive loss of balance. After 2 years, audiometry showed moderate sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear that has not been investigated. Study the given slide and comment on diagnosis:
Identify the given instrument :

options.label: D
options.text: Perkin's self retaining hemostatic mastoid retractor

questions.correct_answer: D. Perkin's self retaining hemostatic mastoid retractor

questions.text: Rameshwer 32 year male came with complaints of decreased hearing since 2 year. On examination both the ear drums were found normal. The Tuning fork test showed Rinne positive in right ear and negative in left, Weber lateralize to right. The patient is showing :-
questions.correct_answer: A. False Negative Rinne Left Ear.

questions.text: Which of the following test is commonly used to screen infant hearing:

An elderly diabetic male presents with severe pain in the ear. On examination he is found to have granulation in external ear, conductive deafness and facial palsy. He was found to be having increased uptake of Tc99m.Most probable diagnosis is:
A 6-month-old infant presents with a unilateral, complete cataract in right eye. There is no family history of eye disease. Which would be most helpful in determining the etiology?

options.label: A
options.text: TORCH (toxoplasmosis, other agents, rubella, cytomegalovirus, herpes simplex) iters and syphilis serology

questions.text: A 10 year old boy was brought by his parents for blurred vision since past 1 month.. On eye examination, the following slit lamp picture was seen. Which of the following would least likely be associated?
questions.correct_answer: C. Low risk of retinal detachment

questions.text: Match the following
What is not true for phacomorphic glaucoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Seen when lens becomes intumescent by the rapid development of cataractous changes

options.label: B
options.text: Can be seen after a traumatic rupture of its capsule

options.label: C
options.text: The lens obliterates the drainage angle causing angle closure

options.label: D
options.text: lens proteins escape into the aqueous

questions.correct_answer: D. lens proteins escape into the aqueous

questions.text: The following findings were noted by the ophthalmologist. What could be the diagnosis and immediate treatment plan? Gonioscopy – open angles Intraocular pressure – 26 mm Hg Optic disc – inferior rim thinning Visual field – as shown

options.label: A
options.text: Primary open angle glaucoma – start topical meds

options.label: B
options.text: Primary angle closure glaucoma – start topical meds

options.label: C
options.text: Primary open angle glaucoma – laser iridotomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Primary open angle glaucoma – start topical meds

questions.text: Select the true statements for Primary angle closure glaucoma 1. First-degree relatives are at increased risk of developing the disease. 2. Angle-closure occurs when physiological states such as close work in twilight 3. The inability to see the posterior trabecular meshwork over more than 180 degrees, is termed an occludable angle 4. It has generally more symptoms than open angle glaucoma

What is the best combination answer for the condition 1. Invades Bowman layer of cornea 2. Elastotic degeneration 3. Iron deposition is seen in stroma of cornea 4. Calcification is seen 5. Mostly seen in people exposed to UV rays
Starting an examination on ptosis, the examiner wants to rule out pseudo-ptosis. He should he look for all these except
Identify the true statement regarding Renal tubular acidosis

options.label: A
options.text: Vitamin D supplementation reverses and prevents bone disease in Distal RTA

options.label: B
options.text: Nephrocalcinosis is a characteristic of Proximal RTA

options.label: C
options.text: Osteopetrosis is associated with Type 3 RTA

options.label: D
options.text: Loop diuretic use can cause Type 4 RTA

questions.correct_answer: C. Osteopetrosis is associated with Type 3 RTA

questions.text: Match the following renal tubular defects with their cause/mimic:
Which of the following is the best strategy to treat a patient with CKD who has a hemoglobin level of 5.8 g/dL, transferrin saturation of 12%, and ferritin level of 300 mg/dL?

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous iron (to achieve transferrin saturation > 20%), then epoetin α if hemoglobin is < 10 g/dL

options.label: D
options.text: Intravenous iron (to achieve transferrin saturation > 20%), then epoetin α if hemoglobin is < 12 g/dL

questions.correct_answer: C. Intravenous iron (to achieve transferrin saturation > 20%), then epoetin α if hemoglobin is < 10 g/dL

questions.text: Match the following:

A 65-year-old Male presented to the Medical OPD with complains of diarrhoea for 3 days. He is a known case of Diabetes for 8 years. On enquiry, he has oliguria and examination revealed postural hypotension. Investigations revealed: Hb-7.3mg/dl, an elevated Serum creatinine of 2.1mg/dl. USG revealed Bilateral enlarged kidney with loss of Corticomedullary differentiation. He was started on IVF, Antibiotics, IV Insulin therapy. After 48 hours later, his repeat Creatinine levels were 2.8mg/dl. What is the diagnosis?
Match the following cast with associated disorders.

Which of the following is/are poor prognostic factor in poststreptococcal glomerulo-nephritis(PSGN): 1. Onset in adults>30years of age 2. Nephrotic presentation of disease 3. Presence of Crescent formation on renal biopsy 4. Delay in initiating Penicillin therapy

25 year-old Male, smoker presented to the clinic with cough and hemoptysis. On examination his BP was 160/100mm of Hg. Urine Analysis revealed dysmorphic hematuria with 100-120RBC/hpf and 2.5g/d of Proteinuria. His Serum creatinine levels were 4.1mg/dl. Both ANCA and Anti-GBM antibody was positive. IF studies on renal Biopsy revealed following finding. What is the diagnosis?
Match the organism associated with risk of auto-immune disease.

A 34 years old male brought to the emergency department with acute abdominal pain. X-ray shows no evidence of gas under diaphragm. Patient has history of passing blood in the urine a month ago. Urine analysis had revealed eumorphic RBC 200/hpf with no casts. He has a history of Raynaud’s phenomenon and asymmetrical neuropathy. What is the probable diagnosis?
Arrange in Chronology the stages of Rheumatoid arthritis (from earliest to late stages) a. Pannus formation b. Irreversible joint deformity c. Bone erosions d. Synovitis
Ankylosing spondylitis is a type of Axial dominant arthropathy. Which of the following components of patient history is more commonly associated with ankylosing spondylitis?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute, spontaneous onset of low back pain

options.label: B
options.text: Onset of symptoms after age 50 years

options.label: D
options.text: Symptoms are typically worse in the morning

questions.correct_answer: D. Symptoms are typically worse in the morning

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman notices increasing shortness of breath after recent treatment for right lower lobe pneumonia. She has no fever, cough, or sputum production. On examination, the pertinent findings are decreased vocal fremitus, dullness on percussion, and absent breath sounds of the right lower lung. In addition, the trachea has shifted to the left.

A 40-year-old woman has been complaining of a3-year history of increasing dyspnea and fatigue.She has no other medical illness. Physical examination reveals increased jugular venous pressure (JVP) with loud P2, and rightsided S4.There are no audible murmurs. CXR reveals clear lung fields and an ECG showsevidence of right ventricular hypertrophy. Pulmonary function tests show a decreased DLCO with normal spirometry parameters. Which of the following is the mostappropriate test to confirm the diagnosis?

A 58-year-old steam pipe worker presents witha vague ache in the left chest and mild dyspnea of several months’ duration. There is dullnesson percussion of the left chest associated with diminished breath sounds. His CXR is shown in Figure. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 66-year-old man with a 40-pack-per-year history of smoking is investigated for hemoptysis. CXR reveals a central 3-cm mass near the leftbronchus. His serum biochemistry is abnormal for elevated calcium, but there is no bonemetastasis on the bone scan. Biopsy of the massis positive for a type of lung cancer associatedwith paraneoplastic hypercalcemia.
Which of the following statements regarding non-invasive testing for Helicobacter pylori is true?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no reliable non-invasive method to detect H pylori.

options.label: B
options.text: Stool antigen testing is appropriate for both diagnosis of and proof of cure after therapy for H pylori.

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma antibodies to H pylori disappear within 2-3 weeks after treatment.

options.label: D
options.text: Breath urea test is useful for early follow up after treatment

questions.correct_answer: D. Breath urea test is useful for early follow up after treatment

questions.text: A 35 year old patient with history of chronic diarrhea without any blood in stools . On general physical examination the finding is observed as shown in the figure. Patient after reading on internet started gluten free diet but without any response in symptoms. What is the most likely cause
Which of the following statements regarding liver function tests is correct:

options.label: A
options.text: The magnitude of elevated AST and ALT has important prognostic significance in acute hepatitis

options.label: B
options.text: Elevation of AST and ALT to >1000 IU/L is typical of ischemic hepatitis.

options.label: C
options.text: Elevation of AST is more specific for liver dysfunction than elevation of ALT.

options.label: D
options.text: Increased AST and ALT with an AST:ALT ratio of >3 is typical of acute viral hepatitis.

questions.correct_answer: B. Elevation of AST and ALT to >1000 IU/L is typical of ischemic hepatitis.

questions.text: A young woman complains of 1 week of fatigue, change in skin colour, and dark brown urine. She has right upper quadrant tenderness and ALT of 1035 U/L, Bilirubin is 15.2 mg/dL (12.1 mg/dL direct- reacting), and the alkaline phosphatase is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient with NAFLD cirrhosis undergoes screening upper endoscopy and is noted to have oesophageal varices with no signs of recent bleeding. What would be the best next step?

options.label: C
options.text: Repeat upper GI endoscopy in 6 months

questions.text: Asymptomatic 64-year-old male coming in for his regular annual medical check up. He had an anterior wall MI 4 years ago. On examination double cardiac apex is seen. There is no murmur. What is your diagnosis?

The ECG below shows a regular, narrow complex tachycardia as shown in the figure in a patient presenting with sudden-onset, rapid palpitation. Which of the following should be used first in attempting to terminate this rhythm?.

A 40-year-old man is found to have edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly. Pulsus paradoxus is present. The examination of his neck veins reveals elevated venous pressure with a deep y descent. Apex beat is not localised. Heart size on x-ray is normal. Which of the following etiologies is not a possible explanation for this syndrome?
False statement about esophageal blood supply is?

options.label: A
options.text: Cervical esophagus receives supply from arch of aorta.

options.label: B
options.text: Thoracic esophagus receives supply from descending aorta.

options.label: C
options.text: Thoracic esophagus drains through azygous vein

options.label: D
options.text: Abdominal esophagus receives supply from left gastric artery

questions.correct_answer: A. Cervical esophagus receives supply from arch of aorta.

questions.text: Which of the following statement is correct regarding of swallowed foreign bodies?

options.label: B
options.text: Most of adults with distal meat impactions have no pathological conditions and no further study is required.

options.label: C
options.text: The most common area for FB’s to be found in children is at the GEJ (T10-11)

options.label: D
options.text: Glucagon is used to relax smooth muscle but is contraindicated in phaeochromocytoma

questions.correct_answer: D. Glucagon is used to relax smooth muscle but is contraindicated in phaeochromocytoma

questions.text: A 55 year old male presented with episodic dysphagia for solids and no dysphagia for liquids, Barium swallow is given below. What is the diagnosis and best treatment for him?

options.label: B
options.text: Schatzki ring and excision of ring

options.label: C
options.text: Plummer Vinson ring and balloon dilatation

options.label: D
options.text: Plummer Vinson ring and excision of ring

questions.correct_answer: A. Schatzki ring and balloon dilatation

questions.text: A 4 week old male child was brought to ED with 2 days H/O projectile non bilious vomiting. O/E a olive shaped lump was palpable in epigastrium. USG showed target sign and antral nipple sign. Which of the following statement is false about this case.

options.label: A
options.text: This patient should be treated as non-surgical emergency.

options.label: B
options.text: Hypochloremic Hypokalemic alkalosis is the normal finding in such cases

options.label: C
options.text: Hartmann’s solution is fluid of choice for resuscitation.

questions.correct_answer: C. Hartmann’s solution is fluid of choice for resuscitation.

questions.text: Management of carcinoma body of stomach which on exploration is only invading the body of pancreas with no distant metastasis

options.label: D
options.text: Total Gastrectomy with pancreatectomy with splenectomy

questions.correct_answer: C. Total Gastrectomy with distal pancreatectomy

questions.text: Wild type of GIST is?

A 60 yr old female known case of Cholelithiasis, presented with upper abdominal pain, non bilous vomiting and features of dehydration. CT showed air in gall bladder and GB was densely adherent to duodenum (Picture given below). Which is most probable diagnosis in her case?
Crtical view of safety of Strasberg include all except?

options.label: B
options.text: Separation of lower third of cystic plate

options.label: C
options.text: Two ductal structure entering gall bladder identified

questions.correct_answer: D. Dissection and identification of CBD

questions.text: A 50 year old patient presented with uncontrolled diabetes and dermatitis (picture given below). CECT showed 3 cm mass in pancreas. Most probabale diagnosis?
Which pf the following is not a treatment modality for Fistula in ano
Treatment of 3 cm size renal hemartoma (Angiomyolipoma) with hematuria is?
Fish hook appearance on IVP is seen in?

A 52 year old male patient presented to the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath associated with bilateral pleuritic chest pain. He denied any history of trauma and had smoked 40 cigarettes daily for the past 22 years. Chest X-ray was taken for evaluation and provided in the image below. Which among the following statements regarding the management of the condition is false?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: If after needle aspiration of 2.5L of size 1-2cm fails to decrease < 1mc repeat needle aspiration.

questions.correct_answer: D. If after needle aspiration of 2.5L of size 1-2cm fails to decrease < 1mc repeat needle aspiration.
